Initialization

Lifetime Management of the Library. More...

Defines

#define DYNATRACE_SET(key_value)   dynatrace_set(key_value)
 Sets a variable for the dynaTrace ADK resp.
#define DYNATRACE_INITIALIZE(argc, argv)   dynatrace_initialize(argc, argv)
 Initializes the dynaTrace ADK.
#define DYNATRACE_REINITIALIZE()   dynatrace_reinitialize()
 Reinitializes the dynaTrace ADK.
#define DYNATRACE_UNINITIALIZE()   dynatrace_uninitialize()
 Uninitializes the dynaTrace ADK.

Detailed Description

Lifetime Management of the Library. 

int main(int argc, char **argv) {
    DYNATRACE_SET("agentname=myApp");
    DYNATRACE_SET("server=myserver");
    int result = DYNATRACE_INITIALIZE(&argc, &argv);
    ...
    DYNATRACE_UNINITIALIZE();
    return 0;
}

Define Documentation

#define DYNATRACE_SET ( key_value   )     dynatrace_set(key_value)

Sets a variable for the dynaTrace ADK resp.

the dynaTrace Agent.

Parameters:
key_value a key value pair of the form "key=value"
Remarks:
Variables set like this override environment variables as well as arguments provided via DYNATRACE_INITIALIZE.

#define DYNATRACE_INITIALIZE ( argc,
argv   )     dynatrace_initialize(argc, argv)

Initializes the dynaTrace ADK.

Any calls happening before this is called are being ignored, except DYNATRACE_SET.

Parameters:
argc count of arguments
argv arguments
Returns:
0 on success, non-zero otherwise
Remarks:
dynaTrace ADK specific arguments will be removed from argv and argc. These are arguments starting with "--dt_".

Variables affecting this call:

  • debugadk=[true|false]
  • agentactive=[true|false]
  • agentlibrary=<path>
All other variables which are deemed dynaTrace specific are being passed to the dynaTrace Agent.

Variables may be set via
  • argc/argv ("--dt_" prefix)
  • environment variables ("DT_" prefix and all upper-case)
  • source code (see DYNATRACE_SET)

 
#define DYNATRACE_REINITIALIZE (  )     dynatrace_reinitialize()

Reinitializes the dynaTrace ADK.

Returns:
0 on success, non-zero otherwise
Remarks:
This call is needed by the child process after fork(), as the dynaTrace Agent was left in a defunct state.

 
#define DYNATRACE_UNINITIALIZE (  )     dynatrace_uninitialize()

Uninitializes the dynaTrace ADK.

Any calls happening after this is called are being ignored.

Remarks:
An application that initialized the dynaTrace ADK via DYNATRACE_INITIALIZE should call this to ensure release of resources.
